summary: The State Department gave money to a UN relief agency that funds certain children’s schools in the West Bank and Gaza. Congress required State to report to them on this agency’s activities. We found State’s reports in FY 2015-2017 weren’t always accurate or detailed. For example, the UN agency evaluated the Palestinian Authority textbooks used in their schools, and found content that didn’t align with...
title: West Bank and Gaza: State Has Taken Actions to Address Potentially Problematic Textbook Content but Should Improve Its Reporting to Congress
